title: Input file has no effect on in-game settings
body: I've been trying for the last hour to get this to work, but i just can't figure it out.  I use mouse button 1 (left click) to attack move on my main.  I've been using this setup for years now with no problem.  Today i tried to edit the settings on my smurf to allow left click, but couldn't for the life of me get it to work.  I've tried deleting the persisted settings file and making input read-only.  It seems like no matter what i do, i can't edit any settings from the input file, whether it be on my main or smurf.  Luckily my main hasn't had any settings get changed throughout all of this, but this is extremely frustrating.

replies.body: so .. i was trying to do the same thing!  i have been playing LOL with default settings but heard that changing to attack move was better.  I saved input file ( althouth i have no idea if my changes are any good or correct xD)  but settings didnt change. Did you guys found the problem?

It sounds like your config could be corrupt, so your settings aren't saving to our servers.  Deleting the persisted settings is a solid step towards getting your config reset.  You're missing a piece to that, though, as you also have to delete game.cfg.

Log into the game client.
Navigate to C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\Config
Delete the file  named **game.cfg** and **persistedsettings.json**
Go into a custom game and verify that settings have saved properly.  Leave game to sync settings. 

Try that out in whole, and let me know if it helps!
and honestly, i'm scared to even mess with it at this point. I don't want to somehow undo the settings on my main and be unable to fix it.

Understandable, but we'd like to keep helping!  Reach out to us in a [support ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) and our tech team will work with you to figure this out.  Grab our [hextech repair tool](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/224826367) as well to gather some logs, and attach it to the ticket for more context.  We'll help out through there!
